intro: Epilobium barnoae, commonly known as the Sierra Valley willowherb, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Onagraceae family and typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and stream banks. The plant has slender stems that are often hairy, and its leaves are lance-shaped with a slightly serrated edge. Its showy flowers, which are usually pink or purple, bloom in late summer and attract various pollinators. Epilobium barnoae is often found in riparian zones and is adapted to thrive in environments with moderate to high moisture levels.
